title: Bichette seeking new era of Blake Street Bombers
subtitle: First-year hitting coach offers unique perspective on effects of Coors Field
body: DENVER -- Dante Bichette knows how it feels to put up strong batting numbers in a Rockies uniform and have them answered by the baseball world with a collective, "Yeah, but ..." During a seven-year stint with the Rockies that saw him earn four All-Star Game trips, he learned to answer, "So what?" The experience makes Bichette, the Rockies' new hitting coach, unique among the coaches who have been asked to work with a team that for 20 seasons has feasted in Denver's altitude and languished on the road. Thomas Harding is a reporter for MLB.com. Read his blog, Hardball in the Rockies, and follow him on Twitter @harding_at_mlb. This story was not subject to the approval of Major League Baseball or its clubs.
author: Thomas Harding
